eventInfoList.dialogueText: I can hardly believe it... you're almost as tall as your old man, @.
Starting high school this year, even! Just as I was getting used to you being a middle schooler.
I'm proud of you. I have no doubt you'll crush it out there.
It probably means less weekend trips with me and your mother too, right? We haven't been going on many of those lately.
But I understand. I was a teenager too! Yeah, ancient history, I know.
The older you get, the more you want to do things your way - to go out and live your own life.
...Enjoy it. As much as you can.
And... be wary. Not everyone out there is like your mother and I, or your teachers and friends at school.
There are some bad people out there. Don't trust everyone you meet.
I guess what I'm trying to say, @, is to stay strong, when you're out there on your own. Don't let anyone screw you over.
How's that for a morning pep talk?
I'll stop lecturing you now - I've gotta go to work! I'll see you around, @, take care of yourself.
